qas.question: Though Turabi proclaimed his support for the democratic process, he strictly applied what after coming into power?

qas.question: How did the party overthrow the elected government in 1929?
Though Turabi proclaimed his rejection for the democratic process, he strictly applied what after coming into power?
Who did the NIF regime not harbor prior to 9/11?

context: After al-Nimeiry was overthrown in <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>1985<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> the party did poorly in national elections, but in 1989 it was able to overthrow the elected post-al-Nimeiry government <a1_0><a1_1><b6_0>with the help of the <a1_2>military<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. Turabi was noted for proclaiming his support for the democratic process and a liberal government before coming to power, but strict application of <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>sharia law<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, torture and mass imprisonment of the opposition, and an intensification of the long-running war in southern Sudan, once in power. The NIF regime also harbored <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>Osama bin Laden<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> for a time (before 9/11), and worked to unify Islamist opposition to <a4_1>the <a4_0><a4_2>American attack on Iraq<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in the 1991 Gulf War.
